David <S%H1732><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Ahimelech, <S%H288><s%> "Isn't <S%H371><s%> there <S%H3426><s%> here under your hand <S%H3027><s%> spear <S%H2595><s%> or sword? <S%H2719><s%> For I have neither brought <S%H3947><s%> my sword <S%H2719><s%> nor my weapons <S%H3627><s%> with me, <S%H3027><s%> because the king <S%H4428><s%>'s business <S%H1697><s%> required <S%H1961><s%> haste. <S%H5169><s%>"

David <S%H1732><s%> laid up <S%H7760><s%> these words <S%H1697><s%> in his heart, <S%H3824><s%> and was very <S%H3966><s%> afraid <S%H3372><s%> of <S%H6440><s%> Achish <S%H397><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Gath. <S%H1661><s%>

Then Achish <S%H397><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to his servants, <S%H5650><s%> "Look, <S%H7200><s%> you see the man <S%H376><s%> is mad. <S%H7696><s%> Why then have you brought him to me? <S%H935><s%>

Do I lack <S%H2638><s%> madmen, <S%H7696><s%> that you have brought <S%H935><s%> this fellow to play the madman <S%H7696><s%> in my presence? <S%H935><s%> Shall this fellow come into my house? <S%H1004><s%>"
